definition: to pull down/(coll.) to let it go/to drop it
to pull/to play (a bowed instrument)/to drag/to draw/to chat
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: When Mickey trips on the stairs of his house, gravity hauls him down.
sentences.chinese: 米奇在他家的楼梯上被绊到的时候，重力会把它拉倒。

sentences.english: One day the curtain will drop and we may all be dragged down.
sentences.chinese: 总有一天帘子掉下来的时候我们会全被拉倒。

sentences.english: They never asked why. They congratulated me, and that was all.
sentences.chinese: 他们从不问为什么我不去了，只是祝贺了我一番拉倒。

sentences.english: The clear orchid continues to lower the head, heart course, you drag down, menace who?
sentences.chinese: 明兰继续低着头，心道，您拉倒吧，唬谁呢？

sentences.english: After all the commotion she is safe and sound .
sentences.chinese: 喧闹过后，她平安无恙，世贸没被拉倒。

sentences.english: Since you don't agree, let's drop it.
I pulled her down on the bed and kissed her.
sentences.chinese: 我把她拉倒在床上，亲吻她。

definition: to be anxious/to get angry with sb
let it be/let it pass/forget about it
to chant/see 梵唄|梵呗[fan4 bai4]
modal particle indicating indicating lack of enthusiasm/modal particle indicating that things should only or can only be done a certain way
in your dreams!/as if!/You wish!/I wish that were so
